  • Mark a specific form element as having an error.
    ErrorElementMod()
  • Add the global "errors" element group to the Form XML Object and place any session "errors" into the group as separate elements.
    ErrorMod()
  • Set the "errornotice" form element to visible.
    ErrorNoticeMod()
  • Add appropriate session variables to the Form Object
    SessionMod()
  • Form Constructor, determines the Formset and other globals using the $formsettings or from the formconf.php file, which is discovered using the conf as it's location.
    __construct()
  • Dumps the current document into an XML Output
    _debug()
  • Adds form elements to the "container" form element group. Elements come from the "container" array.
    addContainer()
  • Adds an element to the error array stored in Session
    addError()
  • Adds a multidemensional array of values to the form.
    addItem()
  • Styroform can display a list of data, for CRUD type operations.
    addList()
  • Add an "Other" item to an auto-generated select list, and append to a specific point in that option list.
    addOther()
  • Adds an HMAC Signature to the form if the "signature" form element group exists.
    addSig()
  • As the name suggests, adds an attribute to a specific form element.
    addStyroformAttribute()
  • Put a specific value in a form element, called most often from the addItem() method, but could be called independently.
    addStyroformDefault()
  • Add an Element Group Form Element Container
    addStyroformElementGroup()
  • Adds a standard Form Element Group, with a child Form Element
    addStyroformElements()
  • Forces an error into the Form, using the Form Validator
    addStyroformError()
  • Adds a set of Values to a form element, specifically select, radio, or checkbox
    addStyroformValues()
  • Adds an element to an array
    array_insert()
  • Determine if a form element is a compound element
    checkCompound()
  • Adds a standard Form Element Group to a Form "Snippet", with a child Form Element
    createStyroformElement()
  • Main controller method, used to render a form into either XML or a string.
    drawForm()
  • Builds server-side dynamic select lists from MySQL Tables or Arrays
    generateOptions()
  • Get the action, which is equivalent to the user's click. Buttons and image clicks are transformed using this method. Reads through all post data looking for a submit.
    getAction()
  • Return an array containing the parts for a compound element
    getCompound()
  • Similar to getAction(), but only looks for specific keys, which is equivalent to the user's click.
    getFormMethod()
  • Adds QueryString Variables to the form, appending if the form doesn't contain an appropriate formelement container.
    getMod()
  • Tests whether the form was posted or not from the CRUD List view. If a list has a form wrapper, elements in the list can contain checkboxes for multi-item deletion.
    isListPosted()
  • Boolean to test which page is currently active
    isPage()
  • Tests whether the form was posted or not from a normal form view.
    isPosted()
  • Creates the objXMLDoc from an XML Form, looking in the following order for, Widget Name/Doc, ROOTNODE (from another XML File)
    loadFormXML()
  • Increments the current form, with an optional param to skip form validation.
    moveForm()
  • Updates the form with the current page, and name
    navMod()
  • Clears the preselected values of a CheckRadio Element
    nullCheckRadio()
  • Adds POST Variables to the form, appending if the form doesn't contain an appropriate formelement container.
    postMod()
  • Adds an array to the form, for use in Select and CheckRadio elements
    registerArray()
  • Adds an element to the removal queue, using the name element from the form element
    removeItem()
  • Deletes and element from the Form XML Object
    removeStyroformElements()
  • Applies items in the mod array to the Form XML Object.
    runMod()
  • Sets the default value of datetime elements if no default data already exists.
    setDefaultDates()
  • Lorem Ipsum Lorem Ipsum Lorem Ipsum Lorem Ipsum Lorem Ipsum Lorem Ipsum
    setErrorNotice()
  • Pops a form element modification on the "mods" array, for later inclusion in the Form XML Object.
    setMod()
  • Serialize the Session Variable Configuration Document
    setSessionVars()
  • Reads the Session Variable Configuration Document, and assigns them to an array The format of this file is below, and it should be located in a secure location along the php include path ("xml/StyroformSessionVars.xml").
    setVars()
  • Create a datetime value from a compound form element.
    sfDateTime()
  • Dumps the current document into an XML Output
    showXML()
  • Remove the querystring variables "page" and "sort" from the URL
    stripQSPage()
  • Processes all the items in the process queue, in the order of ERROR, SELECT OPTS, POST, GET, SESSION, LIST, MODS, ITEM, HMAC, CONTAINER, DATES, then removes any items, and finally does an XSL Transformation if needed, and then returns either a string, or an XML Object
    transformDocument()
  • Creates an XMLFormValidator, tests the form against the available Validators, and returns the results of the Validation.
    validateForm()
  •  Properties
  • Optional XML Root Node Variable, for forms inside of existing xml schemas
    $ROOTNODE
  • Configuration variable read from current form, declaring whether to add HTTP GET variables to form as hidden variables
    $addget_values
  • Configuration variable read from current form, declaring whether to add HTTP POST variables to form as hidden variables
    $addpost_values
  • Configuration variable read from current form, declaring whether to force population of hidden values from an "Item", even if the form element isn't already in the form
    $appenditem_values
  • Configuration variable declaring the base location of XML Assets
    $assetlocation
  • A generic array in which to place other form elements.
    $container
  • Status of the current XML Form Validation
    $cookiename
  • Puts execution in debug mode
    $debug
  • Array of XML Forms in an ordered FormSet
    $docArray
  • An Array of "lookup" arrays for Select Lists to pull from, if not in XML or Database Lookup
    $dynarray
  • Optional Array containing the name and XMLDocument List for the Formset, read generally from either $GLOBALS or from within the WTVR Module, if WTVR
    $formsettings
  • Status of the current XML Form Document
    $isloaded
  • Indicator for FormSet status, true means form is not at position 0 or end position
    $isprocess_step
  • Status of the current XML Form Validation
    $isvalidated
  • Configuration variable for XML Return Object
    $isxml
  • 2-Dimensional Array for adding values to the Form The first element being the item name, the second being the value
    $item
  • Hidden Values that match form element names aren't added by default, this boolean will force that
    $item_forcehidden
  • N-Dimensional Array for adding Lists to the XML Tree, used in CRUD operations.
    $itemlist
  • An array of elements that should be removed from the XML Form Object
    $items_to_remove
  • Modifications to specific elements that are performed after the dom has been procesed.
    $mods
  • Configuration variable declaring the parent module name from within parent Framework
    $module
  • Retains the name of the current form controlled by this object Allows for multiple form controllers on a specific page.
    $name
  • Object container for the XML Session configuration
    $objSessionDoc
  • Object container for the XML Validators configuration
    $objValidateDoc
  • Object container for the current Form, as an XML Object
    $objXMLDoc
  • Object container for the current Form XSL Transformation Document
    $objXSLDoc
  • Removes the doctype declaration from a returned XML Object
    $omit_doctype
  • Retains the number of the currently displayed form in the Formset Starts at zero
    $page
  • Flag to return transformed forms as XML Objects
    $returnxml
  • Array of Session variables that are allowed to translate to form variables, parsed from @link $objSessionDoc
    $session_vars
  • Append Timestamp to XML Form Objext
    $settimestamp
  • Configuration variable read from current form, declaring whether to output the form as formelements or formvariables Not currently supported
    $showform
  • List of elements to skip in validation from the Post Vars
    $skip_missing_post
  • Determines the form page increment
    $step
  • Unclear what this is, deprecated
    $styroform_result
  • Object List of element types that require more than one form element, i.e. day/month/year (3)
    $theCompounds
  • File location of the XML Session configuration
    $theSessionDoc
  • File location of the current XML Form
    $theXMLDoc
  • File location of the current XSL Transformation Document
    $theXSLDoc
  • A list of element types that will have array options generated for them
    $types_array
  • Puts the validator in Debug mode
    $validate_debug
  • Control Variable allowing form controllers to explicitly state that the form is not validated. used for error generation
    $validated

Responsible for controlling the form, drawing, calling the validator, adding "Items" and "ItemLists", and navigating through formsets.

 Methods

Mark a specific form element as having an error.

ErrorElementMod() 

name ErrorElementMod

Add the global "errors" element group to the Form XML Object and place any session "errors" into the group as separate elements.

ErrorMod() 

Also, rewinds the form to the previous page, as these errors stop the form from being successfully processed

name ErrorMod

Set the "errornotice" form element to visible.

ErrorNoticeMod() 

name ErrorNoticeMod

Add appropriate session variables to the Form Object

SessionMod() 

name SessionMod

Form Constructor, determines the Formset and other globals using the $formsettings or from the formconf.php file, which is discovered using the conf as it's location.

__construct(array $formsettings, string $conf) 

name constructor

Parameters

$formsettings

array
  • Array with both Formset, and XSL Doc

$conf

string
  • Name of the WTVR Module, defaults to null

Dumps the current document into an XML Output

_debug() 
Inherited

name _debug
inherited_from \XMLFormUtils::_debug()

Adds form elements to the "container" form element group. Elements come from the "container" array.

addContainer() 

name addContainer

Adds an element to the error array stored in Session

addError(string $name, string $message) 

If the business process rules need to flag a specific field, use this to set the tuple, and it will be reflected in the XML.

name addError

Parameters

$name

string
  • Form Element Name

$message

string
  • Display Message for Error

Adds a multidemensional array of values to the form.

addItem() 

Use this to populate the form values with data, viz:

 XMLForm -> item["someformelement"] = "somevalue";

vals["a"] = 1;
vals["b"] = 2;
XMLForm -> item = vals;

This will then run prior to XSL Transformation, and insert appropriate values to the appropriate form element.

name addItem

Styroform can display a list of data, for CRUD type operations.

addList() 

Use this to add a list to the form, vis:

llistarray["attribs"] = array("attribname1"=>"attribvalue1","attribname2"=>"attribvalue2");
listarray["items"][0] = array("name1"=>"value2","name2"=>"value2");
listarray["items"][1] = array("name1"=>"value2","name2"=>"value2");
listarray["items"][2] = array("name1"=>"value2","name2"=>"value2");
listarray["items"][3] = array("name1"=>"value2","name2"=>"value2");
XMLForm -> list = listarray;

name addList

Add an "Other" item to an auto-generated select list, and append to a specific point in that option list.

addOther(string $nodevalue, array $values) 

 addOther("last|other",array("first"=>1,"second"=>2,"third"=>3));

This will result in a select list, [first, second, third, other]

 addOther("0|other",array("first"=>1,"second"=>2,"third"=>3));

This will result in a select list, [other, first, second, third]

name addOther

Parameters

$nodevalue

string
  • The Value to be Added, (pos, value)

$values

array
  • The Initial Select List

Adds an HMAC Signature to the form if the "signature" form element group exists.

addSig() 

The HMAC Key uses MCRYPT TripleDES, and contains the form name, and a timestamp.

As the name suggests, adds an attribute to a specific form element.

addStyroformAttribute(string $elementname, string $attribute, string $value, string $item) 

Some form elements need "default", or "selected" attributes. Useful also for custom XSL Transformations.

name addStyroformAttribute

Parameters

$elementname

string
  • Name of Form Element

$attribute

string
  • Name of Attribute

$value

string
  • Value of Attribute

$item

string
  • Subnode within the Element Group

Put a specific value in a form element, called most often from the addItem() method, but could be called independently.

addStyroformDefault(string $elementname, mixed $value, string $atype) 

Specific element types need specific types of defaults, i.e. a text element needs a string, a multi-select needs an array, a date needs a valid date.

name addStyroformDefault

Parameters

$elementname

string
  • Name for Form Element

$value

mixed
  • Value of Element

$atype

string
  • Deprecated

Add an Element Group Form Element Container

addStyroformElementGroup(string $path, string $name, string $array, string $id) 

name addStyroformElementGroup

Parameters

$path

string
  • XPath for Element Group Placement

$name

string
  • Name to put in "name" attrubute

$array

string
  • Array of attributes for Group

$id

string
  • ID to put in "id" attribute, optional

Adds a standard Form Element Group, with a child Form Element

addStyroformElements(string $name, string $display, string $atype, string $default, string $aclass, string $vtip, string $required, string $displayclass, string $size, string $pos, string $attribs) 

<FORMELEMENTGROUP>
   <FORMELEMENT>
     <NAME></NAME>
     <DISPLAY></DISPLAY>
     <TYPE></TYPE>
     <DEFAULT></DEFAULT>
     <CLASS></CLASS>
     <VTIP></VTIP>
     <REQUIRED></REQUIRED>
     <DISPLAYCLASS></DISPLAYCLASS>
     <SIZE></SIZE>
  </FORMELEMENT>
</FORMELEMENTGROUP>

name addStyroformElements

Parameters

$name

string
  • Name Subnode

$display

string
  • Display Subnode

$atype

string
  • Type Subnode

$default

string
  • Default Subnode

$aclass

string
  • Class Subnode

$vtip

string
  • Validation Type Subnode

$required

string
  • Required Subnode

$displayclass

string
  • Display Class Subnode

$size

string
  • Size Subnode

$pos

string
  • Name of the Element Group

$attribs

string
  • Array of Attributes for the Element Group

Forces an error into the Form, using the Form Validator

addStyroformError(string $elementname) 

This passes the current Dynarray to the Validator

name addStyroformError

Parameters

$elementname

string
  • Name of the Form Element

Adds a set of Values to a form element, specifically select, radio, or checkbox

addStyroformValues(string $name, array $values, boolean $group) 

If group is specified, a VALUEGROUP element will be appended

 values[0]["sel_key"] = "first";
 values[0]["sel_value"] = "1";
 values[1]["sel_key"] = "second";
 values[1]["sel_value"] = "2";
 XMLForm -> addStyroformValue("someelement",values,true);

name addStyroformValues

Parameters

$name

string
  • Name of Element

$values

array
  • Array of values, array("sel_key"=>"sel_value");

$group

boolean
  • Add optional VALUEGROUP

Adds a standard Form Element Group to a Form "Snippet", with a child Form Element

createStyroformElement(\xmlObj $source, array $array) 

<FORMELEMENTGROUP>
   <FORMELEMENT>
     <NAME></NAME>
     <DISPLAY></DISPLAY>
     <TYPE></TYPE>
     <DEFAULT></DEFAULT>
     <CLASS></CLASS>
     <VTIP></VTIP>
     <REQUIRED></REQUIRED>
     <DISPLAYCLASS></DISPLAYCLASS>
     <SIZE></SIZE>
  </FORMELEMENT>
</FORMELEMENTGROUP>

Main controller method, used to render a form into either XML or a string.

drawForm() : mixed

name drawForm

Returns

mixed(text/XML)

Builds server-side dynamic select lists from MySQL Tables or Arrays

generateOptions(string $type) 

name GenerateOptions

Parameters

$type

string

Get the action, which is equivalent to the user's click. Buttons and image clicks are transformed using this method. Reads through all post data looking for a submit.

getAction() : string

This method has been replaced by getFormMethod()

name getAction

Returns

string

Return an array containing the parts for a compound element

getCompound(string $item) : array
Inherited

Parts are Name and Type

name getCompound
inherited_from \XMLFormUtils::getCompound()

Parameters

$item

string

Returns

array

Similar to getAction(), but only looks for specific keys, which is equivalent to the user's click.

getFormMethod() : string

Buttons and image clicks, are deduced using this method.

name getFormMethod

Returns

string

Adds QueryString Variables to the form, appending if the form doesn't contain an appropriate formelement container.

getMod() 

name getMod

Tests whether the form was posted or not from the CRUD List view. If a list has a form wrapper, elements in the list can contain checkboxes for multi-item deletion.

isListPosted(string $name) : boolean

name isListPosted

Parameters

$name

string
  • The Name of the For

Returns

boolean

Boolean to test which page is currently active

Returns

boolean

Tests whether the form was posted or not from a normal form view.

Returns

boolean

Creates the objXMLDoc from an XML Form, looking in the following order for, Widget Name/Doc, ROOTNODE (from another XML File)

loadFormXML() 

name loadFormXML

Increments the current form, with an optional param to skip form validation.

Updates the form with the current page, and name

navMod() 

Clears the preselected values of a CheckRadio Element

nullCheckRadio() 

name nullCheckRadio

Adds POST Variables to the form, appending if the form doesn't contain an appropriate formelement container.

postMod() 

name postMod

Adds an array to the form, for use in Select and CheckRadio elements

registerArray(string $name, array $array) 

The array isn't a normal two-d array, make sure you use the following format:

$item[0]["sel_key"]="stinky";
$item[0]["sel_value"]="stinky";
$item[1]["sel_key"]="fish";
$item[1]["sel_value"]="fish";

name registerArray

Parameters

$name

string
  • Name of the form element

$array

array
  • Array of names/values

Adds an element to the removal queue, using the name element from the form element

removeItem(string $name) 

name removeItem

Parameters

$name

string

Deletes and element from the Form XML Object

removeStyroformElements() 

Uses the "items_to_remove" array to pull specific items from the Form.

 XMLForm -> removeItem("someelementname");

name removeStyroformElements

Applies items in the mod array to the Form XML Object.

runMod() 

Mods are of type "mod, del, hidegroup", but can be extended to have other functions

Sets the default value of datetime elements if no default data already exists.

 $fpo = something();

Pops a form element modification on the "mods" array, for later inclusion in the Form XML Object.

setMod(string $nodename, string $modtype, string $modvalue, string $position, string $op) 

Parameters

$nodename

string

Name of FormElement (or Group)

$modtype

string

string Type of FormElement

$modvalue

string

string New Node Value

$position

string

int Position relative to Base FOrm

$op

string

string Type of operation [mod|del|hidegroup]

Serialize the Session Variable Configuration Document

setSessionVars() 

name setSessionVars

Reads the Session Variable Configuration Document, and assigns them to an array The format of this file is below, and it should be located in a secure location along the php include path ("xml/StyroformSessionVars.xml").

setVars() 

Any session variables named in this document will be added to the form by default.

name setVars

Create a datetime value from a compound form element.

sfDateTime(string $elementname) 
Inherited

name sfDateTime
inherited_from \XMLFormUtils::sfDateTime()

Parameters

$elementname

string
  • FPO copy here

Dumps the current document into an XML Output

showXML() 
Inherited

name showXML
inherited_from \XMLFormUtils::showXML()

Remove the querystring variables "page" and "sort" from the URL

stripQSPage() 
Inherited

name stripQSPage
inherited_from \XMLFormUtils::stripQSPage()

Processes all the items in the process queue, in the order of ERROR, SELECT OPTS, POST, GET, SESSION, LIST, MODS, ITEM, HMAC, CONTAINER, DATES, then removes any items, and finally does an XSL Transformation if needed, and then returns either a string, or an XML Object

transformDocument() : mixed

name transformDocument

Returns

mixed(text/XML)

Creates an XMLFormValidator, tests the form against the available Validators, and returns the results of the Validation.

validateForm() : boolean

name validateForm

Returns

boolean

Modifications to specific elements that are performed after the dom has been procesed.

$mods : array

For instance, if you need to remove an element, or add an attribute, rather than adding it to the Object Queue that in the "Mods" and it'll be processed after the various other args are applied

access public
name $mods
 

Configuration variable declaring the parent module name from within parent Framework

name $module
 

Retains the name of the current form controlled by this object Allows for multiple form controllers on a specific page.
